fictionBooks.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
fictionBooks.author: Delia Owens
fictionBooks.synopsis: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

fictionBooks.title: THE VANISHING HALF
fictionBooks.author: Brit Bennett
fictionBooks.synopsis: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

fictionBooks.title: 1ST CASE
fictionBooks.author: James Patterson and Chris Tebbetts
fictionBooks.synopsis: After getting kicked out of M.I.T., Angela Hoot interns with the F.B.I. and tracks the murderous siblings known as the Poet and the Engineer.

fictionBooks.title: THE ORDER
fictionBooks.author: Daniel Silva
fictionBooks.synopsis: The 20th book in the Gabriel Allon series. The art restorer and spy cuts his family’s vacation short to investigate whether Pope Paul VII was murdered.

fictionBooks.title: THE GUEST LIST
fictionBooks.author: Lucy Foley
fictionBooks.synopsis: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

fictionBooks.title: NEAR DARK
fictionBooks.author: Brad Thor
fictionBooks.synopsis: The 19th book in the Scot Harvath series. With a bounty on his head, Harvath makes an alliance with a Norwegian intelligence operative.

fictionBooks.title: SUCKER PUNCH
fictionBooks.author: Laurell K Hamilton
fictionBooks.synopsis: The 27th book in the Anita Blake, Vampire Hunter series. The evidence that a wereleopard killed his uncle doesn’t add up.

fictionBooks.title: 28 SUMMERS
fictionBooks.author: Elin Hilderbrand
fictionBooks.synopsis: A relationship that started in 1993 between Mallory Blessing and Jake McCloud comes to light while she is on her deathbed and his wife runs for president.

fictionBooks.title: HARROW THE NINTH
fictionBooks.author: Tamsyn Muir
fictionBooks.synopsis: The second book of the Locked Tomb trilogy. Harrowhark Nonagesimus must overcome her failing health to become an angel of undeath.

fictionBooks.title: THE SILENT WIFE
fictionBooks.author: Karin Slaughter
fictionBooks.synopsis: The 10th book in the Will Trent series. Investigations of two crimes force Trent to call on his girlfriend's expertise as a medical examiner.

fictionBooks.title: AMERICAN DIRT
fictionBooks.author: Jeanine Cummins
fictionBooks.synopsis: A bookseller flees Mexico for the United States with her son while pursued by the head of a drug cartel.

fictionBooks.title: LUSTER
fictionBooks.author: Raven Leilani
fictionBooks.synopsis: A young Brooklyn artist is invited to live with a New Jersey couple who have an open marriage and an adopted daughter.

fictionBooks.title: MEXICAN GOTHIC
fictionBooks.author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
fictionBooks.synopsis: In 1950s Mexico, a debutante travels to a distant mansion where family secrets of a faded mining empire have been kept hidden.

fictionBooks.title: CAMINO WINDS
fictionBooks.author: John Grisham
fictionBooks.synopsis: The line between fact and fiction becomes blurred when an author of thrillers is found dead after a hurricane hits Camino Island.

fictionBooks.title: THE DEATH OF VIVEK OJI
fictionBooks.author: Akwaeke Emezi
fictionBooks.synopsis: In southern Nigeria, an act of violence comes out of the facets of a relationship between cousins Vivek and Osita.

nonFictionBooks.title: LIVE FREE OR DIE
nonFictionBooks.author: Sean Hannity
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election.

nonFictionBooks.title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH
nonFictionBooks.author: Mary L Trump
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.

nonFictionBooks.title: CASTE
nonFictionBooks.author: Isabel Wilkerson
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

nonFictionBooks.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
nonFictionBooks.author: Ibram X Kendi
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

nonFictionBooks.title: MAKE CHANGE
nonFictionBooks.author: Shaun King
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: A look at how social movements evolve and ways in which activists can sustain their efforts.

nonFictionBooks.title: UNTAMED
nonFictionBooks.author: Glennon Doyle
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

nonFictionBooks.title: IT WAS ALL A LIE
nonFictionBooks.author: Stuart Stevens
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The former political campaign strategist evaluates the changes within the Republican Party in the last half-century.

nonFictionBooks.title: HOW TO DESTROY AMERICA IN THREE EASY STEPS
nonFictionBooks.author: Ben Shapiro
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The conservative commentator describes what he perceives as threats to American history, ideals and culture.

nonFictionBooks.title: THE ANSWER IS ...
nonFictionBooks.author: Alex Trebek
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: Who is the Canadian-American game show host whose pronunciation of the word “genre” has been shared widely on social media?

nonFictionBooks.title: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED
nonFictionBooks.author: John Bolton
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The former national security advisor gives his account of the 17 months he spent working for President Trump.

nonFictionBooks.title: BEGIN AGAIN
nonFictionBooks.author: Eddie S Glaude Jr
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: An appraisal of the life and work of James Baldwin and their meaning in relation to the Black Lives Matter movement and the Trump presidency.

nonFictionBooks.title: TRUE CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS
nonFictionBooks.author: Jeffrey Toobin
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The CNN chief legal analyst weaves a narrative of the Mueller investigation, President Trump’s impeachment and transgressions by key Trump figures.

nonFictionBooks.title: EDUCATED
nonFictionBooks.author: Tara Westover
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.

nonFictionBooks.title: BECOMING
nonFictionBooks.author: Michelle Obama
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.

nonFictionBooks.title: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME
nonFictionBooks.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
nonFictionBooks.synopsis: Winner of the 2015 National Book Award for nonfiction. A meditation on race in America as well as a personal story, framed as a letter to the author's teenage son.

personalBookList.title: CASTE
personalBookList.author: Isabel Wilkerson
personalBookList.synopsis: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
